meanings.definition: A device used for brewing coffee.
meanings.sent1: My mom's old percolator makes the best coffee in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The percolator on the stove bubbled as it brewed the coffee.
meanings.sent3: The percolator and the coffee beans had a chat about who was more important in the morning routine.
meanings.sent4: The percolator was a magician turning water into the energizing elixir.
meanings.sent5: The percolator hummed happily, filling the kitchen with the aroma of freshly brewed coffee.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that percolates.
meanings.sent1: The curious percolators in the class always asked insightful questions.
meanings.sent2: The ideas in his mind were like percolators, slowly forming into brilliant solutions.
meanings.sent3: The percolators at the office party were the ones who started the dance-off.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a percolator, filtering through thoughts until the perfect one emerged.
meanings.sent5: The team was a group of percolators, each contributing a unique perspective to the project.

meanings.definition: The process of filtering or passing through a porous substance.
meanings.sent1: The percolators of rainwater through the soil help clean it naturally.
meanings.sent2: The percolators of sunlight through the leaves provide energy for photosynthesis.
meanings.sent3: The percolators of ideas through his mind sometimes led to brilliant inventions.
meanings.sent4: The percolators of time through history reveal the changes in society.
meanings.sent5: The percolators of flavors through the tea leaves create a delicious cup of tea.
